review.star_rating: Rated 4 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Better than Hootsuite that's all I can say. Decent Tweetdeck replacer and has the main requirements...multiple account management, real-time feed, able to see images on feed, able to see animated GIFs on feed (sort-of...it'd be better if you don't switch to a new window just to see a gif.) And the only thing it lacks is able to see 3rd-party videos inside the app and watch in it, example you can't watch Vines or Youtubes, nor can you even see the thumbnails, which irritate me. There are also some links that would display a thumbnail image for Twitter, but won't display on this app which is also irritating. These things I feel should be on all Twitter apps. And lacking one or more just slows down the speed at which you can do things.

review.star_rating: Rated 2 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: I love the UI, and that this is ad-free/open-source. However, a few problems make this app unusable for me. (1) Refreshing the timeline goes to the top, losing my place among the tweets I was reading, requiring a lot of downscrolling to find where I left off. (2) There's no number indicator for how many unread tweets are left. (3) I can't find an obvious way to read a tweet in context of a conversation, which makes many tweets useless. (4) On the trends tab, the loading icon never goes away. (5) Every time I open it, I have to dismiss a notification at the top about usage statistics.

review.review_text: With the death of TweetDeck, I'm left looking for a replacement, and this comes the closest, and even outperforms in some areas. Better than any and everything else I can find on Play, and the pricing can't be beat. Few bugs, and missing features, but one can always hope this will continue to see development. **Edit (30MAR14)** Boosted score to 5 star_ratings: Although not following any regular schedule, Twidere is being updated with reasonable frequency. The most irksome bug has been long since patched out, and I am quite pleased with the current iteration. I have used this app exclusively for several months now, and intend to continue to do so.

review.review_text: Lightweight, nice interface and especially recommended if - like me - you read twitter via lists and prefer to have the choice if pictures get displayed automatically or not. Twidere has lots of options to fit your needs and works a treat. There is only one thing that I like better in the Carbon twitter client: If I share a link to the Pocket app Carbon saves the tweet the link came from with it (so if I decide to retweet it after reading it, I can do that via that tweet). Twidere does not do that (yet) but then not even twitter-official Tweetdeck does it. It's just one minor and very special request I'd have. Anything else about this app is great.

review.star_rating: Rated 5 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: If you're looking for a speedy, high-quality Twitter client with a vast array of functions and capabilities and a clean, attractive interface, LOOK NO FURTHER! Twidere is without the shadow of a doubt the best you can get! I've tried at least seven different Twitter apps, including the official one, but none come close to this one in terms of features and functionality. I've given the app five star_ratings because it really is undeniably FANTASTIC, but I do have a few suggestions I'd like to make: 1) Crashing: This app actually crashes a LOT for me. I have a Galaxy SIII; I don't know if it's my phone or the app, but hopefully it's something that can be fixed either way. 2) Notifications for specific users: Sometimes you follow a celebrity or company or organization whose Tweets you don't want to miss. The official Twitter app gives you the ability to favorite a profile so that whenever they tweet, you get a notification. This might be a good feature to add! As I said before, however, all things considered, this app is literally the best. I only have those two small complaints, but they're not unbearable issues. I'm looking forward to updates and improvements!

But I would really appreciate if this app supports Fullscreen feature as seen in Android 4.4 KitKat

review.review_title: Works well on phone, bit weird on tablet
review.review_text: Twidere works great on my phone; it's fast, responsive and not weighed down by unnecessary UI. On my 9-inch tablet it's a similar story, but the UI is a bit weird with a big gap on one side of the screen and an odd floating placement of the Compose window. But, hey, it's open-source, has no ads and lets you post on Twitter. Recommended!

review.star_rating: Rated 4 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Infinitely better than the standard client, with countless little features and customizations. The option of both light and dark themes is a great bonus; add to that control over nearly every aspect of the app and there's very little you will be left wanting for. The only fault I have found is high battery use; you may need to tweak the way Twidere handles synchronization and refreshes.

review.review_title: PLEASE BRING BACK DUAL PANE VIEW FOR TABLETS IN PORTRAIT MODE
review.review_text: Works even better after the bug fixes. But please bring back dual pane view for tablets in portrait mode! If you wanted to remove it then make it a configurable option instead - I thought it was a better implementation than Plume and would give 5 star_ratings if you brought it back!

review.star_rating: Rated 5 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: It's the best app with holo UI compared to any other like Tweedle. It has ICS looks + great features that makes it different from other ICS like twitter apps. Good work devs

review.star_rating: Rated 5 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Really slick interface

review.star_rating: Rated 5 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Works great, looks great, even open source! Only thing less than perfect is that avatars look somewhat blurry.

review.star_rating: Rated 4 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: the app is very awesome but there are : 1- when refreshing timeline it jumps to top , no option to stay in the last read tweet . 2- color of text in light theme is light also

review.star_rating: Rated 4 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Refresh tweets on launch would be awesome! when I refresh and get new tweets it doesnt stay at my last read tweet it jumps to top instead of staying at last read tweet.

review.star_rating: Rated 5 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_title: Finally What Ive Been Looking For
review.review_text: Nice Light Weight Holo Themed Twitter App That Works Well . Thanks!

review.star_rating: Rated 3 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Good looking app. Glasd it brings the look of ics to my gingerbread phone. Needs list reading and management options though.

review.star_rating: Rated 4 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_title: Very impressed! Hope more features are on the way...
review.review_text: I'd much prefer a DM column (+ option to re-order/edit columns) rather than through the menu button...

review.star_rating: Rated 4 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Auto correct now works.

review.star_rating: Rated 4 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Looks good and simple, had no problems loading dictionary words. Just that loading of tweets are a bit slow compared to official twitter app. Very smooth experience overall

review.star_rating: Rated 5 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: When I try to post a tweet I lose my spell check. This may be already known. Great job otherwise. :)

review.star_rating: Rated 3 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: The client is not letting swiftkey or any keyboard load their dictionary. I have to manually correct every word.

review.star_rating: Rated 4 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Feature Request: Local Trends Possible Bug: Swiftkey does not show suggestion toolbar

review.star_rating: Rated 5 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Want to see getting developed further, make scrolling better plz

review.star_rating: Rated 4 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Keep it up...

review.star_rating: Rated 5 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: The new update pretty much nailed it. No looking back now. This has become my primary client on my phone now. There simply ain't no competition for holo twitter client on low end devices.

review.star_rating: Rated 4 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Holy crud, did this little hidden gem surprise right out of the gate. Not to speak ill of the boys at Boid, but this is everything that I've wanted from them, and in version 0.1.0. The ONLY thing I can complain about is scrolling smoothness - a bit noticeably choppy. Cannot wait to see this develop and evolve. (EDIT: Also, having a refreshed timelime star_ratingt at the bottom of new tweets, not the top, would be FANTASTIC.)

review.star_rating: Rated 5 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Great features and im loving the clean UI style :) Galaxy S2: Android 4.1

review.star_rating: Rated 4 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: UI is fantastic.. just need some features like, list, followers request, longer tweet.

review.star_rating: Rated 3 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: No lists is a deal breaker for me. Very sad... Back to the search for a decent twitter client...

review.star_rating: Rated 5 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: I have faith that this app will success someday.. Goodluck for developers!

review.star_rating: Rated 5 star_ratings out of five star_ratings
review.review_text: Found my new daily driver:)

review.review_text: for twitter client, but it needs tweaking. Can you add some more padding. Everything is too tight atm?
